numbers

Class BufferedPrimeNumberGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • numbers.PrimeNumberGenerator
      • numbers.BufferedPrimeNumberGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Resetable, ResetableIterator<java.lang.Long>, java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Long>

    public class BufferedPrimeNumberGenerator
extends PrimeNumberGenerator
    The BufferedPrimeNumberGenerator is a PrimeNumberGenerator that uses buffers to keep track of previous calculated prime numbers and uses these results to fasten the calculation time of the prime numbers.
    Since:
    19-8-2014
    Version:
    20-8-2014
    Author:
    stefanboodt
    See Also:
    PrimeNumberGenerator

    • Method Detail

      • isPrime

        public boolean isPrime(long number)
        Checks if the given number is a prime number. The lower the number, the sooner it is checked. This uses the stored list of primeNumbers first. This saves a lot of time when used frequently but when the list is corrupted or this version is seldom used it is quicker to use the superclass variant. The list is also considered corrupted when there is a prime number missing in the sequence.
        Overrides:
        isPrime in class PrimeNumberGenerator
        Parameters:
        number - The number you want to check.
        Returns:
        true iff the number is prime.
        See Also:
        PrimeNumberGenerator.isPrime(long)

      • enlist

        protected final void enlist(long number)
        Enlists the number permanently as a prime number. This method should be used only when the isPrime(long) states the number to be a prime number.
        Parameters:
        number - The number to enlist.

      • sortNumbers

        protected void sortNumbers()
        Sorts the number using the sort method.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the resetable so it can be used again from scratch. That is the class is reset so that it is entirely recreated with the same variables as the first time, while maintaining the old references. It is practical for when the original parameters are no longer in existance, but you like to use the old resetable.

        In addition to resetting the list of prime numbers it also saves the newly created list of primenumbers to the file. Notice that this method calls save() in addition to the superclass reset.

        Specified by:
        reset in interface Resetable
        Overrides:
        reset in class PrimeNumberGenerator
        See Also:
        save()

      • save

        public void save()
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Saves the list of prime numbers to the file, so you can start using that as given next time.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file doesn't exist and cannot be created.
